NewWords.WordPhrase: meet or discover by chance 偶然遇见，碰上
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We've just come across an old friend we haven't seen for ages.

NewWords.WordPhrase: manage to see or read 辨认出
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I could barely make out the traffic signs through the rain.

NewWords.WordPhrase: want and expect (sth.) 希望，期待
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I hope for going to college.
e.g. The police found a clue which will help them catch the robber.
e.g. The police are still uncertain of the murderer's identity.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (forbade or forbad, forbidden) vt. 禁止，不许;妨碍
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Smoking is forbidden in the concert hall.
e.g. There's nobody here other than me.
e.g. Let's exchange our views on the matter.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be as good as ( sb. or sth.) 与...一样好;比得上
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. My new dress matches up to the one you have.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (infml) certainly so, without doubt 毫无疑问

NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I felt great relief when I heard I had passed the examination.
e.g. What time does the concert come to an end?
e.g. tie a knot in a piece of string

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. upright, standing on end 挺直的，直立的  vt. 使直立
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. This monument was erected in honor of the martyrs during the internal war.
